citation: Proclamation under the Nature Conservation Act 2002 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Nature Conservation Act 2002

I, the Lieutenant-Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 21(1) of the Nature Conservation Act 2002 declare â€“

        (a) that the area of Crown land specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation, being an area of land within reserved land known as the Tamar Conservation Area, ceases to be part of that reserved land; and
        (b) that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
11 October 2004

W. J. E. COX

Lieutenant-Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

JUDY JACKSON

Minister for Environment and Planning

SCHEDULE 1 - Partial Revocation of Tamar Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising 849.7 square metres shown as Lot 1 and bounded by a heavy black line on Plan 6279 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

SCHEDULE 2 - Plan

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 20 October 2004

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Primary Industries, Water and Environment.
